department: Travaux publics et Services gouvernementaux Canada
description: AMA des services de plongée commerciale - MPO
full_summary:
### Tender Announcement: Commercial Diving Services

#### Solicitation Number
F6813-220003/A

#### Publication Date
August 23, 2022

#### Closing Date and Time
September 20, 2022, 12:30 PM (local time)

#### Tender Status
Expired

#### Trade Agreement
Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

#### Procurement Category
SRV (Professional and Consulting Services)

#### Notice Type
Request for Proposal (RFP)

#### Procurement Method
Competitive - Open bidding (all interested suppliers may submit a bid)

#### Selection Criteria
Lowest Price

#### Regions of Operations
Atlantic North (Newfoundland and Labrador) and Atlantic South Region (Nova Scotia, PEI, and New Brunswick)

#### Regions of Delivery
 Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Prince Edward Island, Newfoundland and Labrador

#### End User Entities
Fisheries and Oceans Canada, Environmental Response, Canadian Coast Guard

#### Contracting Authority
Public Works and Government Services Canada

#### Contact Information
- Genevieve Petten
- 709-682-4097 (phone)
- [genevieve.petten@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca](mailto:genevieve.petten@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca) (email)
- St. John's, NL A1C 5T2

#### Tender Description
The purpose of this Request for Supply Arrangement is to establish a list of pre-qualified Commercial Diving Contractors for the Atlantic Region for use by Fisheries and Oceans Canada, Environmental Response, Canadian Coast Guard for soliciting bids and issuing individual contracts under the terms and conditions of the Supply Arrangement for Pollution Abatement. This procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and all interested suppliers may submit a bid.

#### Requirements
- Delivery of commercial diving services
- Use of Standard acquisition clauses and conditions manual
- Electronic bid submission through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS)

#### Important Notice to Suppliers
* This web site will be the sole authoritative source for Government of Canada opportunities.
* Firms that elect to base their bids on documents obtained from other sources do so at their own risk.
* Standard terms and conditions for this procurement are incorporated by reference into, and form part of, the bid and contract documents.

#### Supporting Documents
The supporting documents are available for download on the Government of Canada's Buyandsell.gc.ca website.

Refer to the attached PDF document for the full textual layout.
